unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: The Perfect Vacation: A Two Way Table
question_text: At a travel expo, $180$ women and $180$ men were randomly selected to be surveyed.  From a list of $7$ options, each individual was asked to identify where they would go for "the perfect vacation".  The results of the survey are displayed below. Women Men Beach 55 41 Mountains 26 35 City 33 28 Country 17 23 Theme Park 21 28 National Park 9 14 Cruise 19 11 If an individual who was surveyed said their perfect vacation would be at the beach or on a cruise, what is the probability that the individual surveyed was a woman?
